title: Polished!
comment: Love the pop-up. Everything works nice now. I appreciate that it allows me to dismiss reminders by giving me a lot more snooze options than just 30 or 60 minutes. A wish.... That i could activate a text response by voice!  Regardless, well done! Updated, after update to kk4.4.2 the app no longer removes the messaging apps notification. A little annoying but I'm sure the Dev will fix.

title: Nice idea, major timezone error
comment: Nice app that pops up alerts for both texts and phone calls.  It would be 4+ stars but is -2 due to bad terrible timezone error. Texts shown as GMT (5 hours later than my US EST location). Calls, however, are stamped correctly.  So, it's a major coding error that's surprising with many bug reports on this.  A 5 hour error when a text is received is a very big deal.  Fix that and I'd upgrade to 4.5 stars.

Depending on the cell carrier SMS messages will be delivered with a timestamp in UTC or local time. This can be fixed by telling the app that the incoming SMS messages are in UTC time and not local time. You can correct this issue by updating the user setting here:

App Settings - Notifications - SMS - Time Is In UTC

title: bug
comment: time is not synch . esp when you recieve your text

Depending on the cell carrier SMS messages will be delivered with a timestamp in UTC or local time. This can be fixed by telling the app that the incoming SMS messages are in UTC time and not local time. You can correct this issue by updating the user setting here:

App Settings - Notifications - SMS - Time Is In UTC

title: Incorrect time

Depending on the cell carrier SMS messages will be delivered with a timestamp in UTC or local time. This can be fixed by telling the app that the incoming SMS messages are in UTC time and not local time. You can correct this issue by updating the user setting here:

App Settings - Notifications - SMS - Time Is In UTC

title: Great app
comment: I really like this app.  It fills a void of something that should be stock Android -- repeating notifications of SMS and missed calls.  Although there are a few glitches...the time of calender items is off by 4 hrs so I'm not using that notification.  Also, I still get the phone's notification bar icon for a missed call (so now there are two), and dismissing the missed call does not clear it.  I'd give this 5 stars with the glitches fixed and some additional background color options for the popup would be nice. -- Update 9/18: App was installed a couple weeks ago.  Worked great until this past weekend when it updated.  Now the notifications will not repeat.  Have emailed developer for help. -- Quick response from developer who released update.  Installed update and repeater works again but force close on every notification.  Contacted developer again. -- Update 9/20: Great response from developer. Bugs fixed; to release update 9/21.

title: Exactly what I needed
comment: Problem: If you are away from your phone, it's hard to know when you missed a call except for little tiny icons in the status bar. Solution: This creates a big, easy to read pop up on your home screen when you've missed a call. It tells you how many calls you missed and you can even dial them from the notification. There are many of these sorts of apps out there, but I had yet to find one that only appeared when a call was missed and then was out of sight when not. This one does it.

comment: I'm still using SMS Popup for infinitely repeating sound/vibrate notifications at a certain interval. Would love to see those 2 options in this app

title: Almost the perfect notification solution
comment: So far this is looking great. Does as it says and supports SMS, Phone, and Calendar. I use this for SMS only and my only two complaints are the lack of status bar notifications and lack of ability to get audio/status bar notifications when pop-ups are suppressed (in call or in messaging app, etc). I'm not too worried though as the dev seems very active and supportive of user requests/suggestions. Once those two things are added it's easily a 5 star app!

title: Woot!
